questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator wants to restrict junior administrators to creating, deleting, and managing virtual machines in the Development folder in the VMware Cloud on AWS vCenter Server instance.
Which type of access should be granted to these junior administrators?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. CloudAdmin role on the Development folder: This grants the necessary permissions to manage VMs within the Development folder without granting broader administrative access to other parts of the vCenter environment. The CloudAdmin role is specifically designed for managing VMs and can be scoped to a particular folder.
B. is the correct answer

Selected Answer: B
CloudAdmin is enough to to the required tasks

There is no Administrator role in vCenter, this is replaced with Cloud Admin. There is an Administrator role in the Cloud Services Console, but this can't be applied to folders. Only answer B makes sense.

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/prescriptive-guidance/latest/identity-access-management-vmware-cloud-aws/vcenter.html

Selected Answer: C
I think C is correct, granting CloudAdmin allows you to:
VirtualMachine.Inventory.Create
VirtualMachine.Inventory.CreateFromExisting
VirtualMachine.Inventory.Delete
VirtualMachine.Inventory.Move
VirtualMachine.Inventory.Register
VirtualMachine.Inventory.Unregister

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vsphere.vmc-aws-manage-data-center-vms.doc/GUID-DFB3C048-5728-4DE9-9380-7240748875C3.html

choices.B: CloudAdmin role on the Development folder
choices.C: Administrator role on the Development folder
choices.D: Administrator role on the cloud vCenter Server instance

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is deploying a new software-defined data center (SDDC) in VMware Cloud on AWS. Long-term planning indicates that a minimum of 30 hosts are required.
What is a valid management network CIDR based on the requirements?

discussion.content:
D
/16 = 4091 hosts
/20 = 251 hosts
/23 = 27 hosts
https://blogs.vmware.com/cloud/2019/10/03/selecting-ip-subnets-sddc/

comments.content:
Agreed with this answer, attaching the AWS official documentation:

SDDC Deployment and Best Practices Guide on AWS
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/whitepapers/latest/sddc-deployment-and-best-practices/account-requirements.html
Section Infrastructure preparation and planning - Table 1 — Design considerations

discussion.content:
C
A /16 is overkill, but 10.0.0.0/15 is one of the reserved IP ranges. Trick question.

Selected Answer: D
/20 VMware on AWS and /22 VMware on azure
D appears correct to me

Isn't it C? Based on: 
Reserved Address Ranges in SDDC Networks
n 10.0.0.0/15
n 172.31.0.0/16
These ranges are reserved within the SDDC management subnet,
but can be used in your on-premises networks or SDDC compute
network segments.

Selected Answer: D
D is correct
/20 VMware on AWS and /22 VMware on azure

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator is looking to migrate several dozen workloads from their on-premises location to a VMware public cloud using the vMotion feature of VMware HCX. A total of three networks will need to be stretched for the migration. They will also be utilizing the capabilities of the WAN appliance to optimize migration traffic.
Based on this scenario, how many IP addresses would need to be reserved for the on-premises deployment of VMware HCX?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
I think the correct answer is 4:
HCX Manager - 1 IP address
HCX Interconnect (IX) - 1 IP address
HCX Network Extension (NE) - 1 IP address (1 NE appliance can extend 8 networks)
1 IP address for the On-Premises vMotion Network

The HCX-WAN-OPT appliance doesn't require an IP address, it automatically uses the Management Network segment configured during the HCX-WAN-IX deployment. It is auto-assigned special use HCX internal RFC-5735 addresses for communications with the HCX-WAN-IX

Selected Answer: B
I agree with 5 IPs
HCX Manager - 1 IP address
HCX Interconnect (IX) - 1 IP address
HCX Network Extension (NE) - 1 IP addresse
HCX WAN Optimization (WANOP) - 1 IP address
1 IP address for the On-Premises vMotion Network

Selected Answer: A
Sorry can I correct myself again? I pick A. four this time
HCX Manager - 1 IP address
HCX Interconnect (IX) - 1 IP address
HCX Network Extension (NE) - 1 IP address (1 NE can extend up to 8 networks, see below)
HCX WAN Optimization (WANOP) - 1 IP address

Extending Layer 2 Networks into AWS with Hybrid Cloud Extensions (HCX)
https://repost.aws/articles/ARNqhoIYwFRk2-alghYZsNaw/extending-layer-2-networks-into-aws-with-hybrid-cloud-extensions-hcx
See step 9

Selected Answer: D
Sorry I failed simple maths on my answer below lol, 1 + 1 + 3 + 1 = 6
I am suggesting six IP is the answer

Selected Answer: B
5 IP's based on https://repost.aws/articles/AROT7OId_pT7mwsyzOZlhbqA/articles/AROT7OId_pT7mwsyzOZlhbqA/hybrid-cloud-extension-hcx-install-guide-for-vmware-cloud-on-aws? where we can find:

Deploy HCX On-Premises
You will need the following before you can deploy HCX on premises
• 3 private IP Addresses from the on premises Management Network, these are for the HCX Manager, HCX Interconnect and HCX Network Extension appliances
• 1 private IP address from the On-Premises vMotion Network

and probably fifth IP will be IP for HCX WAN Optimizer.

Selected Answer: B
I think it's 5 IPs required for on-prem
HCX Manager - 1 IP address
HCX Interconnect (IX) - 1 IP address
HCX Network Extension (NE) - 3 IP addresses (1 IP address for each of the three networks that need to be stretched)
HCX WAN Optimization (WANOP) - 1 IP address

but it says that the deploy is on-prem, so they are the one-sided IPs.

I would say 1 management ip, another for vmotion, another for the network extension, another for the wan optimization, 4 IP

comments.content:
I also think is 4 IPs:
"Deploy HCX On-Premises
You will need the following before you can deploy HCX on premises
 3 private IP Addresses from the on premises Management Network, these are for the HCX Manager, HCX Interconnect and HCX Network Extension appliances
 1 private IP address from the On-Premises vMotion Network"
https://repost.aws/articles/AROT7OId_pT7mwsyzOZlhbqA/hybrid-cloud-extension-hcx-install-guide-for-v-mware-cloud-on-aws

discussion.content: maybe 6 because two IP addres for WAN two for VMotion and two for management of the HCX appliance

choices.C: Notifications sent before a regular update
choices.D: Updates to the software-defined data center (SDDC) software
choices.E: Creation and configuration of VPC during the software-defined data center (SDDC) deployment
choices.A: Capacity management of the cloud software-defined data centers (SDDCs)

discussion.content:
A. Capacity management of the cloud software-defined data centers (SDDCs)
D. Updates to the software-defined data center (SDDC) software

These tasks are part of the managed service provided by VMware, ensuring the cloud infrastructure is optimized and maintained without requiring direct intervention from the customer.

Selected Answer: CD
This question should probably ask for three answers: 
- They send notifications
- They update the SDDC
- They deploy the initial SDDC

So it's CDE

comments.content: They don't create the VPC in the AWS connected account, that is a pre-requisite! The provide a Cloud formation script that is run in the connect VPC that deploys the SDDC

discussion.content: VMware will send notifications of planned updates and then do those updates, so C & D
Answer is AD
is this one right?

questions.question_text: Which two service management tasks in VMware Cloud on AWS are performed by VMware? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Obviously D, because they don't talk about workload migration, but only visibilty

Selected Answer: D
Hybrid Linked Mode is a version of Enhanced Linked Mode that is built for VMware Cloud on AWS.
A doesn't work across different identity domains, D addresses this, B & C don't make sense.

Selected Answer: D
Answer should be D

is D
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vsphere.vmc-aws-manage-data-center-vms.doc/GUID-91C57891-4D61-4F4C-B580-74F3000B831D.html

Selected Answer: D
My answer is D.


Hybrid Linked Mode allows you to link your cloud vCenter Server instance with an on-premises vCenter Single Sign-On domain.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-Cloud-on-AWS/services/com.vmware.vsphere.vmc-aws-manage-data-center-vms.doc/GUID-91C57891-4D61-4F4C-B580-74F3000B831D.html
I belive it should be Hybrid Link Mode ? https://vmc.techzone.vmware.com/resource/feature-brief-hybrid-linked-mode

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

questions.question_text:
A cloud administrator wants to view and manage workloads across both an on-premises environment and a VMware Cloud on AWS software-defined data center (SDDC).
Which solution meets this requirement?
